text: Park Street School of Medicine was a private medical school in Dublin, Ireland. It was founded on Park Street (now Lincoln Place), Dublin, in 1824 by a group of renowned physicians, including Robert James Graves and Arthur Jacob. In 1849, Professor Hugh Carlisle purchased for £500 the School's anatomy specimens which he relocated to Queen's College, Belfast.The Ulster Medical Journal, Volume 59, No. 2, pp. 194 - 199, October 1990. ==Notable faculty== *John Houston *Arthur Jacob ==References== Category:Medical schools in the Republic of Ireland Category:1824 establishments in Ireland Category:Educational institutions established in 1824
title: Park Street School of Medicine
